#G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through a simple web interface, so that I don't need to install and learn new software to deposit.
Benefit: I don't need to install and learn new software to deposit

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to have a user interface that is familiar to me, so that I feel like all the University systems are joined up.
Benefit: I feel like all the University systems are joined up

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Pure, so that I have a single onestop shop for managing my research outputs.
Benefit: I have a single onestop shop for managing my research outputs

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Virtual Research Environments and other workflow tools, so that I can continue to work with tools with which I'm familiar.
Benefit: I can continue to work with tools with which I'm familiar

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit the files that I have, so that I don't have to spend a lot of time finding the right version and converting to the right format.
Benefit: I don't have to spend a lot of time finding the right version and converting to the right format

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to place data under an embargo, so that my right of first use is protected, and I can fulfil my confidentiality responsibilities.
Benefit: my right of first use is protected, and I can fulfil my confidentiality responsibilities

Benefit: my IP rights are protected appropriately

Benefit: we continue to have a productive relationship

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit arbitrarily large files, so that I am not limited in what files I can and cannot deposit.
Benefit: I am not limited in what files I can and cannot deposit

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to link datasets to publications in Opus, so that both my data and publications are more easily discovered.
Benefit: both my data and publications are more easily discovered

Benefit: it can be discovered and cited more easily and citations can be tracked so that I can receive credit

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to have metadata automatically filled from other University systems and remembered from previous deposits, so that I don't have to waste time reentering the same information.
Benefit: I don't have to waste time reentering the same information

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to link to data stored in external repositories, so that I can store my data in an appropriate repository but still register it with the University and I don't have to deposit my data in multiple places.
Benefit: I can store my data in an appropriate repository but still register it with the University and I don't have to deposit my data in multiple places

Benefit: I can demonstrate the impact of my work

Benefit: I can demonstrate the impact of my work

Benefit: I can use my data in the future and I can fulfil funder requirements for archival

Benefit: researchers in my discipline can find my data more easily

Benefit: compliance with DMP can be demonstrated and whole project workflow is linked together

Benefit: whole project workflow is linked together

Benefit: changes to the dataset are transparent and do not compromise research integrity

Benefit: I can delegate research data management tasks appropriately

Benefit: I can easily find data relevant to my needs

Benefit: I am not put off reusing University of Bath data by language barriers

Benefit: I can make a preliminary assessment of usefulness without downloading the whole dataset

Benefit: I can reference it correctly

Benefit: university data storage is consistent and maintainable and future availability of data can be guaranteed

Text: #G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that the digital copy I deposit is stored redundantly, so that when one copy suffers destruction or unwanted changes, I still have other good copies to restore from.

Text: #G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that threats to copies in one repository are not automatically incurred by the redundant copies.

#G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that the redundant copies are continuously monitored for unwanted changes, and that if/when changes do occur, there is a mechanism by which I can determine the original object and restore it to all copies.
#G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that the assets can be taken out of the repository, and that the assets taken out are the same as those that are put in.

#G27# As an asset manager, I want to know what the intellectual value of the asset is to the institution at the time of deposit, so that I obtain guidance in the evaluation of it for current value for the institution.

Text: #G27# As an asset manager, I want to have a mechanism to obtain a listing or understanding of all the assets that have been deposited, and their current status.
